intro: Antirrhinum meonanthum subsp. salcedoi, commonly known as the Salcedo's snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the genus Antirrhinum, which includes various species of snapdragons, and is characterized by its distinctive, bilaterally symmetrical flowers. The subspecies salcedoi is distinguished by its smaller, more elongated flower tubes and narrower leaves compared to other members of the species. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. This plant is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological traits and limited distribution.
